H0.text: Voltaic cells are the type of cells that, when connected multiple times, form a battery.

H1.text: Cabri cells are the cells that are multipleâ€‘connected to form a battery.

H2.text: Organic cells are the kind of cells that a battery is a multiple connection of.

H3.text: Localweather cells are the kind of cells that are connected in multiple to form a battery.

A4.text: A battery is a set of two or more galvanic cells that are connected in series to form a single source of voltage.

A5.text: The first batteries had many galvanic cells.
